title: Common English Vocabulary Words that Start with L

json.text: Welcome to PnT English channel. A learning vocabulary with videos channel.
Welcome to the oxford 3000 essential words program. Now, let's start learning English!
Section 12: Words Starting with L. l. l . l. l is the twelfth letter of the English
alphabet. It is also the written abbreviation of litre or litres. A metric unit of capacity
equal to the volume of 1 kilogram of pure water at 4 degrees centigrade and 760 mm of
mercury. A liter bottle of wine. label. l . a . b . e . l . label. label means
a brief description given for purposes of identification. The label Modern is applied
to many different kinds of architecture. laboratory. l . a . b . o . r . a . t . o
. r . y . laboratory. laboratory means a workplace for the conduct of scientific research. A
research laboratory. labor. l . a . b . o . r . labor. labor means
productive work especially physical work done for wages. His labor did not require a great
deal of skill. lack. l . a . c . k . lack. lack means the
state of needing something that is absent or unavailable. There is a serious lack of
insight into the problem. lacking. l . a . c . k . i . n . g . lacking.
lacking means not existing. Innovation has been sadly lacking.
lady. l . a . d . y . lady. lady means a polite name for any woman. A nice lady at the library
helped me. lake. l . a . k . e . lake. lake means a body
of usually fresh water surrounded by land. We swam in the lake.
lamp. l . a . m . p . lamp. lamp means an artificial source of visible illumination.
She could see the rain in the light of the street lamps.
land. l . a . n . d . land. land means the land on which real estate is located. He built
the house on land leased from the city. landscape. l . a . n . d . s . c . a . p . e
. landscape. landscape means an expanse of scenery that can be seen in a single view.
We can expect changes in the political landscape. lane. l . a . n . e . lane. lane means a narrow
way or road. Winding country lanes. language. l . a . n . g . u . a . g . e . language.
language means a systematic means of communicating by the use of sounds or conventional symbols.
He taught foreign languages. large. l . a . r . g . e . large. large means
above average in size or number or quantity or magnitude or extent. A large number of
newspapers. largely. l . a . r . g . e . l . y . largely.
largely means in large part; mainly or chiefly. These accounts are largely inactive.
last. l . a . s . t . last. last means the temporal end; the concluding time. It's the
last house on the left. late. l . a . t . e . late. late means being
or occurring at an advanced period of time or after a usual or expected time. Late 18th
century. later. l . a . t . e . r . later. later means
happening at a time subsequent to a reference time. He's going to the store but he'll be
back here later. latest. l . a . t . e . s . t . latest. latest
means up to the immediate present; most recent or most up-to-date. The very latest scientific
discoveries. lately. l . a . t . e . l . y . lately. lately
means in the recent past. Lately the rules have been enforced.
latter. l . a . t . t . e . r . latter. latter means referring to the second of two things
or persons mentioned. In the latter case. laugh. l . a . u . g . h . laugh. laugh means
the sound of laughing. He laughed unpleasantly at his own jest.
launch. l . a . u . n . c . h . launch. launch means set up or found. She launch a literacy
program laundry. l . a . u . n . d . r . y . laundry.
laundry means garments or white goods that can be cleaned by laundering. A laundry basket.
law. l . a . w . law. law means legal document setting forth rules governing a particular
kind of activity. There is a law against kidnapping. lawyer. l . a . w . y . e . r . lawyer. lawyer
means a professional person authorized to practice law; conducts lawsuits or gives legal
advice. Prosecution and defense lawyers are expected to deliver closing arguments next
week. lay. l . a . y . lay. lay means put into a
certain place or abstract location. Lay the dogs on the scent of the missing children.
layer. l . a . y . e . r . layer. layer means single thickness of usually some homogeneous
substance. Slices of hard-boiled egg on a layer of spinach.
lazy. l . a . z . y . lazy. lazy means moving slowly and gently. Lazy white clouds.
lead. l . e . a . d . lead. lead means take somebody somewhere. Can you lead me to the
main entrance? leading. l . e . a . d . i . n . g . leading.
leading means indicating the most important performer or role. Leading members of the
government. leader. l . e . a . d . e . r . leader. leader
means a person who rules or guides or inspires others. He was not a natural leader.
leaf. l . e . a . f . leaf. leaf means the main organ of photosynthesis and transpiration
in higher plants. The forest was just coming into leaf.
league. l . e . a . g . u . e . league. league means an association of sports teams that
organizes matches for its members. He makes his football league debut tomorrow.
lean. l . e . a . n . lean. lean means to incline or bend from a vertical position.
She leaned over the banister. learn. l . e . a . r . n . learn. learn means
gain knowledge or skills. She learned dancing from her sister.
least. l . e . a . s . t . least. least means used to form the superlative. The garter snake
is the least dangerous snake. at least. at least. at least means if nothing
else. At least he survived. leather. l . e . a . t . h . e . r . leather.
leather means an animal skin made smooth and flexible by removing the hair and then tanning.
The soles are made of leather. leave. l . e . a . v . e . leave. leave means
go away from a place. At what time does your train leave?
leave out. leave out. leave out means prevent from being included or considered or accepted.
The bad results were leave out from the report. lecture. l . e . c . t . u . r . e . lecture.
lecture means a speech that is open to the public. He attended a lecture on telecommunications.
left. l . e . f . t . left. left means being or located on or directed toward the side
of the body to the west when facing north. The left bank of a river is bank on your left
side when you are facing. leg. l . e . g . leg. leg means a human limb;
commonly used to refer to a whole limb but technically only the part of the limb between
the knee and ankle. How many legs does a centipede have?
legal. l . e . g . a . l . legal. legal means established by or founded upon law or official
or accepted rules. They are currently facing a long legal battle in the US courts.
legally. l . e . g . a . l . l . y . legally. legally means by law; conforming to the law.
We are legally wedded now. lemon. l . e . m . o . n . lemon. lemon means
yellow oval fruit with juicy acidic flesh. A gin and tonic with ice and lemon, please.
lend. l . e . n . d . lend. lend means bestow a quality on. Her presence lends a certain
cachet to the company. length. l . e . n . g . t . h . length. length
means the linear extent in space from one end to the other. The length of the table
was 5 feet. less. l . e . s . s . less. less means quantifier
meaning not as great in amount or degree. Less time to spend with the family.
lesson. l . e . s . s . o . n . lesson. lesson means a unit of instruction. He took driving
lessons. let. l . e . t . let. let means make it possible
through a specific action or lack of action for something to happen. This sealed door
won't let the water come into the basement. letter. l . e . t . t . e . r . letter. letter
means a written message addressed to a person or organization. Mailed an indignant letter
to the editor. level. l . e . v . e . l . level. level means
a position on a scale of intensity or amount or quality. A moderate level of intelligence.
liberal. l . i . b . e . r . a . l . liberal. liberal means showing or characterized by
broad-mindedness. Generous and liberal sympathies. library. l . i . b . r . a . r . y . library.
library means a room where books are kept. They had brandy in the library.
license. l . i . c . e . n . s . e . license. license means a legal document giving official
permission to do something. This restaurant has a license to sell alcohol.
lid. l . i . d . lid. lid means either of two folds of skin that can be moved to cover
or open the eye. His lids would stay open no longer.
lie. l . i . e . lie. lie means be located or situated somewhere; occupy a certain position.
Don't lie in the sun for too long. life. l . i . f . e . life. life means a characteristic
state or mode of living. He hoped for a new life in Australia.
lift. l . i . f . t . lift. lift means raise from a lower to a higher position. Lift the
box onto the table. light. l . i . g . h . t . light. light means
electromagnetic radiation that can produce a visual sensation. The light was filtered
through a soft glass window. lightly. l . i . g . h . t . l . y . lightly.
lightly means without good reason. One cannot say such things lightly.
like. l . i . k . e . like. like means similar to someone or something. She's wearing a dress
like mine. unlike. u . n . l . i . k . e . unlike. unlike
means marked by dissimilarity. For twins they are very unlike.
likely. l . i . k . e . l . y . likely. likely means has a good chance of being the case
or of coming about. These services are likely to be available to us all before long.
unlikely. u . n . l . i . k . e . l . y . unlikely. unlikely means not likely to be true or to
occur or to have occurred. Legislation on the question is highly unlikely.
limit. l . i . m . i . t . limit. limit means the greatest possible degree of something.
What he did was beyond the limits of acceptable behavior.
limited. l . i . m . i . t . e . d . limited. limited means small in range or scope. A limited
circle of friends. line. l . i . n . e . line. line means a formation
of people or things one beside another. The line of soldiers advanced with their bayonets
fixed. link. l . i . n . k . link. link means the
means of connection between things linked in series. Police suspect there may be a link
between the two murders. lip. l . i . p . lip. lip means either of
the two soft edges at the opening to the mouth. The assistant pursed her lips.
liquid. l . i . q . u . i . d . liquid. liquid means a substance that is liquid at room temperature
and pressure. She poured the dark brown liquid down the sink.
list. l . i . s . t . list. list means the property possessed by a line or surface that
departs from the vertical. The ship developed a list to starboard.
listen. l . i . s . t . e . n . listen. listen means hear with intention. Listen to the sound
of this cello. literature. l . i . t . e . r . a . t . u
. r . e . literature. literature means creative writing of recognized artistic value. Great
works of literature. liter. l . i . t . e . r . liter. liter means
a metric unit of capacity equal to the volume of 1 kilogram of pure water at 4 degrees centigrade
and 760 mm of mercury (or approximately 1.76 pints). A liter of water.
little. l . i . t . t . l . e . little. little means limited or below average in number or
quantity or magnitude or extent. A little dining room.
a little. a little. a little means to a small degree; somewhat. Felt a little better.
live. l . i . v . e . live. live means inhabit or live in. People lived in Africa millions
of years ago. living. l . i . v . i . n . g . living. living
means pertaining to living persons. Within living memory.
lively. l . i . v . e . l . y . lively. lively means full of life and energy. Lively and
attractive parents. load. l . o . a . d . load. load means weight
to be borne or conveyed. The trucks waited at the warehouse to pick up their loads.
unload. u . n . l . o . a . d . unload. unload means leave or unload, especially of passengers
or cargo. The truck driver was waiting to unload.
loan. l . o . a . n . loan. loan means the temporary provision of money. Loan me some
money. local. l . o . c . a . l . local. local means
relating to or applicable to or concerned with the administration of a city or town
or district rather than a larger area. Local authorities.
locally. l . o . c . a . l . l . y . locally. locally means by a particular locality. It
was locally decided. locate. l . o . c . a . t . e . locate. locate
means discover the location of; determine the place of; find by searching or examining.
Can you locate your cousins in the Midwest? location. l . o . c . a . t . i . o . n . location.
location means a determination of the place where something is. A honeymoon to a secret
location. lock. l . o . c . k . lock. lock means a fastener
fitted to a door or drawer to keep it firmly closed. This suitcase doesn't lock.
logic. l . o . g . i . c . logic. logic means the branch of philosophy that analyzes inference.
It made a certain kind of logic. logical. l . o . g . i . c . a . l . logical.
logical means capable of or reflecting the capability for correct and valid reasoning.
A logical mind. lonely. l . o . n . e . l . y . lonely. lonely
means lacking companions or companionship. The lonely skier on the mountain.
long. l . o . n . g . long. long means measuring or covering a great length or distance, or
a greater length or distance than usual. She had long dark hair.
look. l . o . o . k . look. look means perceive with attention; direct one's gaze towards.
She looked over the expanse of land. look at. look at. look at means take into
consideration for exemplifying purposes. Look at that! What a horrible mess!
look for. look for. look for means try to locate or discover, or try to establish the
existence of. They are looking for the missing man in the entire county.
look forward. look forward. look forward means expect or hope for. I look forward to hear
from you soon. loose. l . o . o . s . e . loose. loose means
not restrained or confined or attached. A pocket full of loose bills.
loosely. l . o . o . s . e . l . y . loosely. loosely means in a relaxed manner; not rigid.
His hands lay loosely. lord. l . o . r . d . lord. lord means a person
who has general authority over others. She's married to a lord.
lose. l . o . s . e . lose. lose means fail to keep or to maintain; cease to have, either
physically or in an abstract sense. Sit down or you'll lose your seat.
lost. l . o . s . t . lost. lost means no longer in your possession or control; unable
to be found or recovered. His lost book. loss. l . o . s . s . loss. loss means the
act of losing. Everyone expected him to win so his loss was a shock.
lot. l . o . t . lot. lot means a large number or amount or extent. A lot of money.
loud. l . o . u . d . loud. loud means characterized by or producing sound of great volume or intensity.
A group of loud children. loudly. l . o . u . d . l . y . loudly. loudly
means with relatively high volume. She spoke loudly and angrily.
love. l . o . v . e . love. love means a strong positive emotion of regard and affection.
Children need a lot of love. lover. l . o . v . e . r . lover. lover means
a person who loves or is loved. He denied that he was her lover.
low. l . o . w . low. low means less than normal in degree or intensity or amount. The
reservoir is low. lower. l . o . w . e . r . lower. lower means
move something or somebody to a lower position. Lower the vase from the shelf.
loyal. l . o . y . a . l . loyal. loyal means steadfast in allegiance or duty. Loyal friends
stood by him. luck. l . u . c . k . luck. luck means your
overall circumstances or condition in life including everything that happens to you.
The luck of the Irish. lucky. l . u . c . k . y . lucky. lucky means
blessed with good fortune. Considered himself lucky that the tornado missed his house.
unlucky. u . n . l . u . c . k . y . unlucky. unlucky means having or bringing misfortune.
Friday the 13th is an unlucky date. lump. l . u . m . p . lump. lump means a large
piece of something without definite shape. A lump of coal.
lunch. l . u . n . c . h . lunch. lunch means a midday meal. She ate a small lunch before
the meeting. lung. l . u . n . g . lung. lung means either
of two saclike respiratory organs in the chest of vertebrates; serves to remove carbon dioxide
and provide oxygen to the blood. Smoking can cause lung cancer.
Thanks for watching! This is all for section 12: Words starting with L. You can move on
to section 13 : Words starting with M. We'll see you next time. Goodbye!
